org.numenta.nupic.network

Class Region

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.network.Region
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Persistable

    public class Region
extends java.lang.Object
implements Persistable

    Regions are collections of Layers, which are in turn collections of algorithmic components. Regions can be connected to each other to establish a hierarchy of processing. To connect one Region to another, typically one would do the following: 

          Parameters p = Parameters.getDefaultParameters(); // May be altered as needed
      Network n = Network.create("Test Network", p);
      Region region1 = n.createRegion("r1"); // would typically add Layers to the Region after this
      Region region2 = n.createRegion("r2"); 
      region1.connect(region2);
    --OR-- 
          n.connect(region1, region2);
    --OR-- 
          Network.lookup("r1").connect(Network.lookup("r2"));
    Author:
    cogmission
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • close

        public Region close()
        Closes the Region and completes the finalization of its assembly. After this call, any attempt to mutate the structure of a Region will result in an IllegalStateException being thrown.
        Returns:

      • compute

        public <T> void compute(T input)
        Used to manually input data into a Region, the other way being the call to start() for a Region that contains a Layer which in turn contains a Sensor -OR- subscribing a receiving Region to this Region's output Observable.
        Parameters:
        input - One of (int[], String[], ManualInput, or Map<String, Object>)

      • getInput

        public java.lang.Object getInput()
        Returns the current input into the region. This value may change after every call to compute(Object).
        Returns:

        public <any> observe()
        Returns an Observable which can be used to receive Inference emissions from this Region
        Returns:

      • start

        public boolean start()
        Calls Layer.start() on this Region's input Layer if that layer contains a Sensor. If not, this method has no effect.
        Returns:
        flag indicating that thread was started

      • restart

        public boolean restart(boolean startAtIndex)
        Calls Layer.restart(boolean) on this Region's input Layer if that layer contains a Sensor. If not, this method has no effect. If "startAtIndex" is true, the Network will start at the last saved index as obtained from the serialized "recordNum" field; if false then the Network will restart from 0.
        Parameters:
        startAtIndex - flag indicating whether to start from the previous save point or not. If true, this region's Network will start at the previously stored index, if false then it will start with a recordNum of zero.
        Returns:
        flag indicating whether the call to restart had an effect or not.

      • getCheckPointOperator

        CheckPointOp<byte[]> getCheckPointOperator()
        Returns an rx.Observable operator that when subscribed to, invokes an operation that stores the state of this Network while keeping the Network up and running. The Network will be stored at the pre-configured location (in binary form only, not JSON).
        Returns:
        the CheckPointOp operator

      • halt

        public void halt()
        Stops each Layer contained within this Region

      • isHalted

        public boolean isHalted()
        Returns a flag indicating whether this Region has a Layer whose Sensor thread is halted.
        Returns:
        true if so, false if not

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Finds any Layer containing a TemporalMemory and resets them.

        public void resetRecordNum()

      • connect

        public Region connect(java.lang.String toLayerName,
                      java.lang.String fromLayerName)
        Connects two layers to each other in a unidirectional fashion with "toLayerName" representing the receiver or "sink" and "fromLayerName" representing the sender or "source". This method also forwards shared constructs up the connection chain such as any Encoder which may exist, and the Inference result container which is shared among layers.
        Parameters:
        toLayerName - the name of the sink layer
        fromLayerName - the name of the source layer
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Region is already closed

      • lookup

        public Layer<?> lookup(java.lang.String layerName)
        Does a straight associative lookup by first creating a composite key containing this Region's name concatenated with the specified Layer's name, and returning the result.
        Parameters:
        layerName -
        Returns:

      • completeAssembly

        private void completeAssembly()
        Called by start(), observe() and connect(Region) to finalize the internal chain of Layers contained by this Region. This method assigns the head and tail Layers and composes the Observable which offers this Region's emissions to any upstream Regions.

      • configureConnection

        <I extends Layer<Inference>,O extends Layer<Inference>> void configureConnection(I in,
                                                                                 O out)
        Called internally to configure the connection between two Layer Observables taking care of other connection details such as passing the inference up the chain and any possible encoder.
        Parameters:
        in - the sink end of the connection between two layers
        out - the source end of the connection between two layers
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Region is already closed

      • connect

        <I extends Layer<Inference>,O extends Layer<Inference>> void connect(I in,
                                                                     O out)
        Called internally to actually connect two Layer Observables taking care of other connection details such as passing the inference up the chain and any possible encoder.
        Parameters:
        in - the sink end of the connection between two layers
        out - the source end of the connection between two layers
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if Region is already closed
